abstract: T. Rowe Price, the investment manager, is planning to buy a 26 percent stake in India’s UTI Asset Management for $134-144 million, The Economic Times reported.
snippet: T. Rowe Price, the investment manager, is planning to buy a 26 percent stake in India’s UTI Asset Management for $134-144 million, The Economic Times reported.
lead_paragraph: T. Rowe Price, the United States investment manager, is planning to buy a 26 percent stake in India’s UTI Asset Management Company for 6.5 billion to 7 billion rupees ($134 million to $144 million), The Economic Times reported, citing two people familiar with the matter.

headline.main: T. Rowe Price Said to Eye Stake in India’s UTI
